Topic.Title: Easter = A Time To be Humble & Reflect

Message.Msg: ...“…perhaps earn by what you sew (sic)…” - More brilliance from Jon, who’s apparently a part-time seamstress. Hey, jon, so that you can reap what you sow, I’ll give you a buck and a half for that Tea Party quilt you’re sewing. Oh, that’s a sweater for your puppy, Grover? Never mind. And the plural of destiny is destinies, not destiny’s. Sell your sewing machine and buy a dictionary, you dimwit.
Awesome report !

...“You're an insignificant, small minded, nasty little whiner that must have an awful lonely life…” – winholder Uh, winholder, I believe the two choices were: Either: “I’m sorry, my facts were completely unfounded, and I was totally wrong.” Or: “Okay, you caught me again. I’m simply a paid shill here to confuse people with total nonsense I make up to pimp for the Gun Lobby, despite the fact that 92% of Americans, including the rank and file members of the NRA, support gun legislation. We’ll take your response to mean the latter.

Message.Title: North Korea
Message.Msg: I think I have figured out what the newest quack to run this fantasyland is trying to accomplish. He figures that he can extort more billions out of the U.S. as his daddy did if he promises to be a good boy. That or he actually plans to attack the U.S. but not on a large enough scale to get totally annihilated in the process. We fought Japan and Germany, and then rebuilt their countries and economies. We attacked Iraq and then Afghanistan and are in the process of spending billions to rebuild what we destroyed and a lot of things they never had in the first place. He is looking for a rebuilding of his country and economy on the backs of American taxpayers and just isn't sure if the extortion ruse will work again. He figures if he pushes hard enough, we or SK will make the decision for him.
Great report !

The Iraq and Afghanistan wars will cost the U.S. $6 trillion before all is said and done. Imagine if that money had been spent on infrastructure and education. Your great great grandchildren will be paying for these fiascos. The U.S. isn't going to give NK more than food aid for as long as it has nuclear capability. SK wants reunification, which won't happen as long as the NK regime remains.
